reporting-org.narrative: Association des Editeurs du Magazine Jimbere

title.narrative: Share-Net Burundi

description.narrative: Established in 2014, Share-Net Burundi is the knowledge platform on Sexual and reproductive health and Rights (SRHR). With a focus on youth, its mission is to improve Burundian SRHR through open communication, knowledge-sharing, research facilitation, and advocacy geared towards healthy policy-making. SN-BU has 70 organisational members from sectors including academia, policy makers, practitioners and NGOs and 20 individual members. The platform is strong of five Communities of Practices: Adolescents and Youth Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights, Media in SRHR, HIV/AIDS, Menstrual Health, Family planning. Share-Net Burundi is one of the 7 national hubs that are part of Share-Net International. Since July 2020, Share-Net Burundi is hosted by Jimbere Magazine Publishers Association (ASSEMAJI) whose main project, Jimbere Magazine, is a monthly publication conceived as a media platform that is generally committed to training, educating and entertaining the youth of Burundi, with a special emphasis on the status of women.

participating-org.narrative: Association des Editeurs du Magazine Jimbere

recipient-country.narrative: Burundi, located in East Africa, is a small landlocked country known for its stunning landscapes and rich cultural heritage. It is bordered by Rwanda, Tanzania, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Despite its small size, Burundi boasts diverse wildlife, including rare species like mountain gorillas. The country has faced political challenges and social unrest in the past, but it continues to make progress towards stability and development. Burundi's people are resilient and known for their warmth and hospitality, making it a captivating destination for travelers seeking off-the-beaten-path experiences.

comment.narrative: Share-Net Burundi has prepared the policy brief on the Role of Burundian medias in SRHR and a The Narrative review on contraception among young people and the quality of their reception in the family planning service in Burundi.

description.narrative: Knowledge sharing

title.narrative: Number of subscribers to the newsletter

description.narrative: Number and kind of knowledge that has been shared through SNI and the country hubs

comment.narrative: We planned to explore whatspp to disseminate newsletter

Share-Net Burundis secretariat used both email (80 subscribers) and its WhatsApp groups (68) to disseminate its newsletters and other relevant information for members and communities of practice. Each community of Practice has its Whatsapp group. Beyond this number, 280 people have registered via the website as subscribers to the newsletter

title.narrative: Percentage of opened newsletters

description.narrative: Number and kind of knowledge that has been shared through SNI and the country hubs

comment.narrative: As the newsletters are sent directly by email and through the members' whatsapp group, the % of people who have opened the newsletter is difficult to calculate. But in the whatsapp group, the newsletter is usually viewed by all 68 participants

description.narrative: Networking and matchmaking

title.narrative: Number of active Communities of Practice

description.narrative: Number of CoPs that have been established and their respective topics

comment.narrative: In Burundi, all of the existing national communities of practice are active except for the infertility community of practice, where members are not active because there is little knowledge available and also less investment in this area. With WHO, we have discussed how to revitalize this community of practice but for now much of the effort is directed towards family planning and other issues of interest to the government.

title.narrative: Networking at national (CoP) and international level (partners)

description.narrative: Networking and matchmaking

title.narrative: Number of newly registered members (per sector)

description.narrative: Efforts SN has made to broaden its network

comment.narrative: By the end of 2020, after the membership re-engagement cycle, Share-Net Burundi had 35 active members. By the end of 2021, that number had almost doubled to 68 active members

title.narrative: Networking at national (CoP) and international level (partners)

description.narrative: Networking and matchmaking

title.narrative: Number of new (inter)national partnerships established

description.narrative: Efforts SN has made to broaden its network

comment.narrative: This is the most notable partnership , Share-Net Burundi has received funding from the Dutch Embassy in Burundi to coordinate a large sexual and reproductive health project (SRHR Solutions) involving several national and international organizations working in this field. The first cycle (two years out of four) of this project started on July 1, 2021 and will end on June 30, 2023.

title.narrative: Number of subscribers to the newsletter

description.narrative: Number and kind of knowledge that has been shared through SNI and the country hubs

comment.narrative: We planned to explore whatspp to disseminate newsletter

Share-Net Burundis secretariat used both email (80 subscribers) and its WhatsApp groups (68) to disseminate its newsletters and other relevant information for members and communities of practice. Each community of Practice has its Whatsapp group. Beyond this number, 280 people have registered via the website as subscribers to the newsletter

comment.narrative: As the newsletters are sent directly by email and through the members' whatsapp group, the % of people who have opened the newsletter is difficult to calculate. But in the whatsapp group, the newsletter is usually viewed by all 68 participants

description.narrative: Networking and matchmaking

title.narrative: Number of active Communities of Practice

description.narrative: Number of CoPs that have been established and their respective topics

comment.narrative: In Burundi, all of the existing national communities of practice are active except for the infertility community of practice, where members are not active because there is little knowledge available and also less investment in this area. With WHO, we have discussed how to revitalize this community of practice but for now much of the effort is directed towards family planning and other issues of interest to the government.

description.narrative: Efforts SN has made to broaden its network

comment.narrative: By the end of 2020, after the membership re-engagement cycle, Share-Net Burundi had 35 active members. By the end of 2021, that number had almost doubled to 68 active members

description.narrative: Efforts SN has made to broaden its network

comment.narrative: This is the most notable partnership , Share-Net Burundi has received funding from the Dutch Embassy in Burundi to coordinate a large sexual and reproductive health project (SRHR Solutions) involving several national and international organizations working in this field. The first cycle (two years out of four) of this project started on July 1, 2021 and will end on June 30, 2023.

reporting-org.narrative: Association des Editeurs du Magazine Jimbere

title.narrative: Share-Net Burundi

description.narrative: Established in 2014, Share-Net Burundi is the knowledge platform on Sexual and reproductive health and Rights (SRHR). With a focus on youth, its mission is to improve Burundian SRHR through open communication, knowledge-sharing, research facilitation, and advocacy geared towards healthy policy-making. SN-BU has 70 organisational members from sectors including academia, policy makers, practitioners and NGOs and 20 individual members. The platform is strong of five Communities of Practices: Adolescents and Youth Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights, Media in SRHR, HIV/AIDS, Menstrual Health, Family planning. Share-Net Burundi is one of the 7 national hubs that are part of Share-Net International. Since July 2020, Share-Net Burundi is hosted by Jimbere Magazine Publishers Association (ASSEMAJI) whose main project, Jimbere Magazine, is a monthly publication conceived as a media platform that is generally committed to training, educating and entertaining the youth of Burundi, with a special emphasis on the status of women.

participating-org.narrative: Association des Editeurs du Magazine Jimbere

recipient-country.narrative: Burundi, located in East Africa, is a small landlocked country known for its stunning landscapes and rich cultural heritage. It is bordered by Rwanda, Tanzania, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Despite its small size, Burundi boasts diverse wildlife, including rare species like mountain gorillas. The country has faced political challenges and social unrest in the past, but it continues to make progress towards stability and development. Burundi's people are resilient and known for their warmth and hospitality, making it a captivating destination for travelers seeking off-the-beaten-path experiences.

description.narrative: Instalment 1 (45% of the annual budget for 2023 as stated in article 7 of 2023 Terms of Reference.)

title.narrative: Number of active Communities of Practice

description.narrative: Number of CoPs that have been established and their respective topics

comment.narrative: The reason the Diversity and Inclusion CoP fell asleep at its early stage is that the incident in Gitega that involved 24 people has caused more woes within the LGBTQI+ community in Burundi. Amongst the 24 imprisoned, 1 died in captivity, 4 have been sentenced a year and others have been liberated later January 2024. In 2024, we will continue exploring with UHAI and AidsFonds ways to digitally engage with members in Burundi and in the region through the regional community of practice to be set covering Burundi, Kenya and Uganda.
